title: Where we are in the year?

data.title: Where we are in the year?
data.statement:
You need to calculate the <<[[percentage]] of advancement>> for the year (rounded to 2 decimal places, like 13.24%).

For example, on January 31, 2023, the year's advancement is 8.49%, on December 31, 2024, it is 100%.

Note: beware of leap years (i.e. years with 29 days in February)
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> string [[dday]] of the day in the format of [[y]]{{/}}[[m]]{{/}}[[d]]

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You need to calculate the percentage of advancement for the year (rounded to 2 decimal places, like 13.24%).

For example, on January 31, 2023, the year's advancement is 8.49%, on December 31, 2024, it is 100%.

Note: beware of leap years (i.e. years with 29 days in February)
Input
Line 1: string dday of the day in the format of y/m/d
Output
Line 1: percentage
Constraints
Example
Input
2023/1/31
Output
8.49
